qas.question: What process replaces tissue damaged by TB?
What material can sometimes be expelled by coughing if the cavities it's stored in connect to bronchi?
What type of bacteria-attacking medicine will treat tuberculosis?
Are the bacteria in caseous necrotic material living or dead?
What is affected tissue filled with?
What do cavities join with in the waning period?
What joins with air passages to prevent material from being coughed up?

context: In many people, the infection waxes and wanes. Tissue destruction and necrosis are often balanced by healing and fibrosis. <b4_0>Affected tissue<b4_0/> is replaced by <a0_0>scarring<a0_0/> and cavities filled with <a1_0><b5_0>caseous necrotic material<b5_0/><a1_0/>. During active disease, some of these <b8_0>cavities<b8_0/> are joined to the <b6_0>air passages bronchi<b6_0/> and this material can be coughed up. It contains <a3_0>living<a3_0/> bacteria, so can spread the infection. Treatment with appropriate <a2_0><b7_0>antibiotics<b7_0/><a2_0/> kills bacteria and allows healing to take place. Upon cure, affected areas are eventually replaced by scar tissue.
